content:
In today's digital world, service disruptions are inevitable. Web outages occur. Code changes or corrupt data bring down servers. Severe weather causes power outages or delivery delays. When service incidents like these happen to your business, you want to analyze the cause, streamline service operations, and minimize downtime.

Customer Service Incident Management from Service Cloud helps your teams track large-scale disruptions and delegate tasks to the right experts to ensure that your business delivers on customer expectations. With built-in fields, page layouts, and best practices, Customer Service Incident Management helps your service teams respond to any disruption and keep customers informed.

With Customer Service Incident Management, you can:

Proactively identify and address incidents.
Provide agents and response teams a centralized place to track and manage the incident.
Leverage a unified console where incident, customer, and case data is easy to find.
Meet service level agreements (SLAs).

Cases and Incidents help your service teams resolve customer issues of different scale. An incident manager can identify an incident, start a swarm, track the incident, diagnose the problem, share updates, and resolve the incident.

Customer Service Incident Management Objects and Fields include cases and incidents with built-in fields for tracking and managing large-scale disruptions.
title: Customer Service Incident Management
